faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: If you don’t see your question here, feel free to contact us — we’ll be happy to help you personally.

items.a: Payments are handled directly between you and your client (bank transfer, cash, or other methods). We don’t integrate third-party gateways at checkout; the store automatically generates the order, and you collect the payment directly.

items.q: Can I upgrade or change plans later?
items.a: Yes, you can upgrade, downgrade, or switch plans anytime. ByteWorks will handle all necessary migrations — pages, content, and configurations — so you don’t lose anything.

items.q: Who manages the products in my store?
items.a: By default, ByteWorks manages all products for you: adding, updating, and removing them as needed. However, if you prefer to handle them yourself, we can enable secure admin access and provide a quick training or guide.

items.q: Can both ByteWorks and I manage products together?
items.a: Absolutely. Many clients prefer shared management: ByteWorks handles bulk or technical updates, while you edit simple details like prices or descriptions. We’ll configure user roles so everything stays organized and safe.
All plans include basic SEO to ensure visibility on Google. You can upgrade to the Advanced SEO Add-on for deeper optimization, analytics, and keyword strategy.
Yes. The E-Commerce Plan includes an internal delivery tracking system so your customers can check their order status without relying on external couriers.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At ByteWorks, we respect your privacy. We only collect the minimum information needed to respond to your requests and provide our services.

collect.title: Information We Collect
collect.body: When you contact us, we collect your name, email address, project type, and your message. We do not collect sensitive categories of personal data.

use.title: How We Use Your Information
use.li1: To reply to your inquiry and provide quotes or proposals.
use.li2: To manage leads and internal follow-ups in our workspace.
use.li3: To improve our site and services in aggregate (non-identifiable) ways.

tools.title: Third-Party Tools
tools.body: We use trusted providers to deliver our services securely:
tools.notion: • Notion — stores lead metadata (name, email, project type, language). We do not store your message in Notion.
tools.resend: • Resend — sends emails (internal notification and optional auto-reply).
tools.vercel: • Vercel — hosts the website. Access logs may include IP address for security.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.body: We keep lead information only as long as necessary for communication and business follow-up, after which we delete or anonymize it.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.body: You may request access, correction, or deletion of your data by contacting us. We will respond within a reasonable timeframe.

contact.title: Contact
contact.body: For privacy requests, email us at support@byteworks.dev.
